algorithm_technique: Prefix sums (or XOR prefix sums) for character counts and parity check.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a substring can become a palindrome by rearranging and replacing up to 'k' characters.
problem_summary_technical: Use prefix sums of character counts to find character frequencies in substrings. Check if character count parities allow palindrome formation with 'k' replacements.
key_insights: A string can form a palindrome if at most one character has an odd count.
The number of characters that need to be changed to make a substring a palindrome is half the number of characters with odd counts.
Prefix sums (or XOR prefix sums) allow efficient calculation of character counts within any substring.
